text: Lenodora vittata is a moth of the family Lasiocampidae first described by Francis Walker in 1855. It is found in India and Sri Lanka. ==Biology== The caterpillar is a pest of rice. Brachymeria species are known parasitoids of the moth. ==References== ==Further reading== * Botanical pesticides – a major alternative to chemical pesticides: A review Category:Moths of Asia Category:Moths described in 1855
title: Lenodora vittata
